msbt.message: Happy Valentine's Day, kiddo! I've been keepin' this around to give to someone special, and I've decided that someone's you. Yeah, yeah, I know. Just don't go gettin' all sappy on me, y'hear?
Somehow Valentine's Day got the drop on me. But I was ready with my one-two punch: gifts and kind words for those special to me. That means you, kiddo! Thanks for bein' you. Enjoy the present.

Now, I'll be the first to admit that givin' out roses ain't my style—but then again, it's Valentine's Day, an' if ever there was a day for makin' an exception... Anyhoo, I hope this brings a smile to ya, kiddo.

I'm no good at this Valentine's Day claptrap, so bear with me... Happy Valentine's Day to a swell someone in my life. That'd be you. Huh! That didn't come out so bad! I reckon you just inspire that in me.
This is a smidge too embarrassin' for me to say out loud, so I wrote it out on this Valentine's Day card instead: thanks for always bein' so kind and warm. I'm truly lucky to know ya, kiddo!
I reckon you've got Valentine's Day gifts pilin' up from here to the stars. Well, have another! You're too good a neighbor for me not to celebrate, so I got you something I hope you'll enjoy.
Seein' as it's Valentine's Day and all, there's something I feel I don't tell ya near enough: you're just about the best neighbor this could ask for. Thank you for bein' swell, .
How goes your Valentine's Day? Told anyone how you feel about 'em yet? Not that I have, mind... but I'm about to, right here in this letter. Thanks for being a great neighbor and an even greater pal.

I used to think it was crass to jam all your feelings onto a piece of paper instead of saying 'em out loud, but here we are. I know most times I seem grumpy, but I'm always thankful I'm pals with you, kiddo.
